meanings.definition: To assess or determine the value of something again.
meanings.sent1: I am revaluating my stamp collection to see if any are rare.
meanings.sent2: She is revaluating the price of her old car before selling it.
meanings.sent3: The detective kept revaluating the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: Revaluating the importance of family is like finding hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: Revaluating the antique vase revealed its true historical significance.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or reevaluate a decision or opinion.
meanings.sent1: After the argument, he is revaluating his stance on the issue.
meanings.sent2: They are revaluating their vacation plans due to the weather forecast.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be revaluating its choice of napping spot.
meanings.sent4: Revaluating her favorite book made her appreciate it even more.
meanings.sent5: Revaluating his friendship with Tom brought clarity to his thoughts.
